column4: all: where do I go to see if someone if working on making an Ubuntu package for a certain product?
also mplayer has a -dumpstream flag and it can handle mms streams
thanks for the recommendation...I'll check it out
no need - recovery mode gives root prompt by default
how do you get to "recovery mode"
hit <esc> on boot, select recovery mode from the grub menu
thanks,  I've never actually tried that...isn't that a little unsecure to have that option available to easily
well, anyone with physical access to the machine can boot single user anyway
that's true...it just seems a little obvious...I guess anyone who would know how to harm you computer anyways would already know how to boot into so manually
or just boot a live CD and chroot into the install on disc
there are multiple ways, as always
why do modern Linux versions even have the so option anyways?
I have no idea :) I'm just a user, not a dev
but as I said, chroot can do pretty much the same thing
that's true, but you'd at least need to have a liveCD handy
all you need really is either a floppy ( tomsrootboot) or a live CD, yes
